page.title: 09Farming in Gwyddelwern area
page.content: {Farming}is the major industry. There are a few dairy farms, from which the milk is taken to a creamery in the vale of Clwyd for cheese making. {Sheep}rearing is ideal for this area, the popular breeds are Border Leicester, Welsh Half Breds, Suffolk and Kerry Crosses and the Pure Welsh. {Stock}rearing is undertaken, Hereford & Continental breeds are the main but Welsh Blacks and Friesians are reared. There are very good livestock markets within a radius of 25 miles for all animals. The climate is not advantages for cereal growing but some farmers do grow them mainly for their own use. Hay is harvested on most farms but silage especially the Big Bale is catching on. The majority of farms are owner/occupied and are family run. Mrs Ruth Francis.
